page.title: 12Recreation in Monks Kirby.
page.content: For such things such as scouts and cubs the children have to travel to Brinklow.Some children take part in bell ringing at St.Ediths church. A number of children have music lessons. They play instruments such as, piano, flute, violin and trumpet.A few children belong to bands which play at many local functions.Horse riding is another favourite pastime,many of the children have their own horse or pony and enjoy riding through the lanes of Monks Kirby. For the adults in the village there are the two pubs as well as the Service mens club in Pailton.Hobbies include,restoring and running vintage cars,wood turning,bell ringing, reading,bird watching and golfing.
